Package org.lgdcloudsim.statemanager

Class SynStateSimple

java.lang.Object
org.lgdcloudsim.statemanager.SynStateSimple
All Implemented Interfaces:
SynState
public class SynStateSimple extends Object implements SynState
This class implements the interface SynState. For SynState, its state representation has 3 layers.
  • selfHostState: The state of the hosts that the intra-scheduler have scheduled instances to, so that the intra-scheduler need to record the state of the allocated hosts in its view to the selfHostState.
  • synState: The state of the hosts in different partition synchronization time. Note the it will only record the states of the changed hosts during the partition synchronization time. For more details, see StatesManagerSimple.
  • nowHostStates: The actual state of all hosts in the datacenter.
Since:
LGDCloudSim 1.0
Author:
Anonymous

  • Field Details

    • selfHostState

      Map<Integer,Map<Integer,int[]>> selfHostState
      When scheduling, it will pretend that the previous scheduling result is successful, so the ideal state of the scheduled host will be saved in this dictionary, the purpose is not to modify other data.

    • synState

      Map<Integer,TreeMap<Double,Map<Integer,int[]>>> synState
      The host status here refers to the host status obtained during synchronization

      Parameters:
      synState - the state of the hosts in different partition synchronization time.
      nowHostStates - the actual state of all hosts in the datacenter.
      partitionRangesManager - the partition ranges manager.
      selfHostState - the state of the hosts that the intra-scheduler have scheduled instances to.
      scheduler - the intra-scheduler.
      predictionManager - the prediction manager.
      synGapManager - the syn gap manager.
      predictRecordNum - the record data num for predicting.
      predictable - whether to use the prediction function.

  • Method Details

    • getHostState

      public HostState getHostState(int hostId)
      When looking for the host state, we need to check whether there is relevant host data in selfHostState, and then try to call getSynHostState to obtain synhost. If there is still no, it means that the host state has not changed. We go to hostState to obtain the corresponding Host Status.
      Specified by:
      getHostState in interface SynState
      Parameters:
      hostId - the id of the host.
      Returns:
      the host state.

    • isSuitable

      public boolean isSuitable(int hostId, Instance instance)
      Determine whether this instance is suitable for placement in a hostId host.
      Specified by:
      isSuitable in interface SynState
      Parameters:
      hostId - the id of the host
      instance - the instance to be placed
      Returns:
      true if the instance can be placed in the hostId host, otherwise false

    • allocateTmpResource

      public void allocateTmpResource(int hostId, Instance instance)
      When the scheduler decides to schedule the instance to a certain host, this function needs to be called to update the scheduled host state to selfHostState. Note that the instance may fail to be scheduled. In this case, we need to call StatesManager.revertSelfHostState(java.util.List<org.lgdcloudsim.request.Instance>, org.lgdcloudsim.intrascheduler.IntraScheduler) to modify the status back.
      Specified by:
      allocateTmpResource in interface SynState
      Parameters:
      hostId - the id of the host
      instance - the instance to be placed

    • getSynHostState

      private int[] getSynHostState(int hostId)
      Get the state of the host when synchronized.
      Parameters:
      hostId - the host id to get the state
      Returns:
      the state of the host when synchronized

    • getPredictSynState

      private int[] getPredictSynState(int hostId)
      Get the predicted host state. Note that if the smallSynGap is 0, the predicted host state is null. Because we have the latest host state,we don't need to predict the host state. It will use the data stored in synState for a period of time to make predictions.
      Parameters:
      hostId - the host id to predict
      Returns:
      the predicted host state
